Source file src/github.com/haraldrudell/parl/error116/chainstring.go

Documentation: github.com/haraldrudell/parl/error116 

     1  /*

     5  
     6  package error116
     7  
     8  import (
     9  	"errors"
    10  	"fmt"
    11  )
    12  
    13  const (
    14  	// DefaultFormat %v output
    15  	DefaultFormat Format = iota + 1
    16  	// ShortFormat one-line location %-v
    17  	ShortFormat
    18  	// LongFormat full stack trace %+v
    19  	LongFormat
    20  	// ShortSuffix one-line without message
    21  	ShortSuffix
    22  	// LongSuffix full stack trace without message
    23  	LongSuffix
    24  )
    25  
    26  // ChainStringer converts an error chain to string format
    27  type ChainStringer interface {
    28  	ChainString(format Format) string
    29  }
    30  
    31  // Format describes string conversion of an error chain
    32  type Format byte
    33  
    34  // Short stringifies errors with one-line extra data
    35  func Short(err error) string {
    36  	return ChainString(err, ShortFormat)
    37  }
    38  
    39  // Long stringifies errors with all extra data
    40  func Long(err error) string {
    41  	return ChainString(err, LongFormat)
    42  }
    43  
    44  // ChainString  can print an error chain of any errors
    45  func ChainString(err error, format Format) (s string) {
    46  	var didError bool
    47  	for err != nil {
    48  		if chainStringer, _ := err.(ChainStringer); chainStringer != nil {
    49  			s += chainStringer.ChainString(SuffixFormat(format, didError))
    50  			break // error.ChainString prints everything properly, we are done
    51  		}
    52  		if !didError {
    53  			s += err.Error() // prints a chain of wrapped errors, but with no extra data
    54  			if format == DefaultFormat {
    55  				break // default format calls or nothing else
    56  			}
    57  			didError = true // string error messages have already been printed
    58  		}
    59  		err = errors.Unwrap(err)
    60  	}
    61  	return
    62  }
    63  
    64  // SuffixFormat takes into account if the wrapped error chain has already been printed
    65  func SuffixFormat(format Format, didError bool) (f2 Format) {
    66  	if didError && format == LongFormat {
    67  		f2 = LongSuffix
    68  	} else if didError && format == ShortFormat {
    69  		f2 = ShortSuffix
    70  	} else {
    71  		f2 = format
    72  	}
    73  	return
    74  }
    75  
    76  // PrintfFormat gets Format for the Printf v verb
    77  func PrintfFormat(s fmt.State) Format {
    78  	if s.Flag('+') {
    79  		return LongFormat
    80  	} else if s.Flag('-') {
    81  		return ShortFormat
    82  	}
    83  	return DefaultFormat
    84  }
    85  

Build version go1.17.8.
